newsitem.title: USA: Asarco to close Leadville mine.
newsitem.headline: Asarco to close Leadville mine.

text.p: Asarco Inc said Tuesday it will indefinitely shut down its Leadville mine in Colorado beginning December 31 due to depressed lead and zinc concentrate prices.
The unit will be placed on a care-and-maintenance basis in order to conserve ore reserves, the company said.

The mill at Leadville has been shut down since August because of a structural failure. Seventy-eight employees of the mill were laid off at that time. Economic reasons, which were not foreseeable then, now dictate a shutdown of the entire unit, Asarco said.
About 120 employees, including those laid off in August, will be affected by the shutdown, the company said.

As openings become available at other locations, qualified employees will be considered on a priority basis, it added. The Leadville mine produced 15,400 tons of zinc, 5,000 tons of lead, and 347,000 ounces of silver in 1995.
